snippet.title: Open Source Friday with Cilium
snippet.description:
On this week’s Open Source Friday, we highlight Cilium, an open source project that provides modern networking, security, and observability for cloud-native environments using eBPF. 

03:30 Welcome to Open Source Fridays
03:49 Introduction to Cilium
04:45 The Evolution of Networking
05:11 Challenges in Container Networking
06:40 What is eBPF?
08:39 The Power of eBPF in Linux Kernel
13:32 Why Choose Cilium?
14:32 Cilium's Key Features
19:04 Hands-On with Cilium
24:03 Network Policy Deployment
24:27 Observability with Hubble
26:06 Getting Started with Cilium
26:39 Cilium's Expanding Capabilities
28:52 Business Value of Cilium
30:06 Operational Costs and Migration
33:50 Contributing to Cilium
36:36 The Role of the eBPF Foundation
41:38 Conclusion and Final Thoughts

Links mentioned: 
- https://ebpf.io/
- https://ebpf.foundation/
- https://cilium.io/
- https://github.com/cilium/cilium/
- https://www.linkedin.com/company/cilium/
- https://isovalent.com/labs/cilium-getting-started/
- https://cilium.io/newsletter/
- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wb_vD3XZYOA

Stay up-to-date on all things GitHub by subscribing and following us at:
YouTube: http://bit.ly/subgithub
Blog: https://github.blog
X: https://twitter.com/github
LinkedIn: https://linkedin.com/company/github
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/github
TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@github
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/GitHub/

About GitHub:
It’s where over 180 million developers create, share, and ship the best code possible. It’s a place for anyone, from anywhere, to build anything—it’s where the world builds software. https://github.com
